simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous, brooding sci-fi noir with moral ambiguity I can sink into.

simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner 2049 (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Immersive and beautiful, a slower, thoughtful continuation that respects the world.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut paranoia and practical dread that had me on edge the whole time.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Grim, tightly constructed thriller with a gut-punch ending that lands.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Dry, sun-baked cynicism and layered intrigue that rewards attention.

recommended_movies: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2011)

simulated_ratings.title: Gattaca (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, humane sci-fi about identity and class that scratches my itch for ideas over spectacle.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, twisty time-paranoia that rewards attention and lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Looper (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, pulpy time-crime with heart, even if the seams show a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: Dune (2021)

simulated_ratings.title: Interstellar (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ambitious and heartfelt with awe to spare, though the sentiment softens the edges for me.
